chapter.title: TCP Port and Address
chapter.para: Cockpit's cockpit-ws component is configured by default to accept connections on port 9090. This is the port that is documented for a "Web-based System Manager" to listen on. It is also relatively memorable.

However there are many reasons you may wish to change the default port. For example other software may use port 9090 or you may wish to setup Cockpit to listen on 443 instead. It is also possible to have Cockpit only listen on one specific IP address.

Note that it is only required to have Cockpit listening on a TCP port on the server that you access with your web browser. If you add multiple servers to the Cockpit dashboard, Cockpit will connect to those servers via ssh.
The systems that Cockpit runs on are typically locked down with firewalls, SELinux, so changing the default port is not as easy as editing a configuration file.

section.title: Cockpit systemd Socket
section.para: On servers with systemd Cockpit starts on demand via socket activation. To change its port and/or address you should place the following content in the /etc/systemd/system/cockpit.socket.d/listen.conf file. Create the file and directories in that path which not already exist. The ListenStream option specifies the desired TCP port.
In order for the changes to take effect, run the following commands:
section.programlisting: $ sudo systemctl daemon-reload $ sudo systemctl restart cockpit.socket
